content.title: Intro
content.content: -më is a Quenya suffix which usually denotes abstract, or at least rather intangible, things.[1]

content.title: Examples
content.content:
Isilmë = "moonlight"[source?]
melmë = "love" ("to love"; MEL)[source?]
nilmë = "friendship" ("friend"; NIL)[source?]
telmë = "cover" ("hood"; TEL)[source?]
qualmë = "agony, death" ("to die in pain"; KWAL)[source?]

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, "Words, Phrases and Passages in Various Tongues in The Lord of the Rings: Eldarin Roots and Stems", in Parma Eldalamberon XVII (edited by Christopher Gilson), p. 68
